title: Calories in Ham Slices
meta_description: Learn calories in ham slices with a full nutrition breakdown, including protein, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for your meal.
assumptions: Deli-style smoked ham, thinly sliced, ~28 g per slice, cooked/cured, no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, curing method, slice thickness, and added preservatives. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of ham provide ~90 kcal, 10 g protein, and high sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one ham slice?
faqs.a: About 45 kcal per 28 g slice of deli ham.
Yes, two slices have ~800 mg sodium; opt for low-sodium if watching intake.

faqs.q: What is the protein in ham slices?
faqs.a: Two slices provide ~10 g protein, good for a quick snack.

faqs.q: Calories in ham slices vs. turkey slices?
faqs.a: Ham is similar or slightly higher; turkey slices are often ~30-40 kcal each.

faqs.q: Does cooking affect calories in ham slices?
faqs.a: Deli ham is pre-cooked; frying adds oil/calories, while plain slices stay consistent.
